alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Plymouth; Suffolk; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 4:55PM EDT until July 16 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Worcester County in central Massachusetts... Norfolk County in eastern Massachusetts... Suffolk County in eastern Massachusetts... Southern Essex County in northeastern Massachusetts... Eastern Middlesex County in northeastern Massachusetts... Northwestern Bristol County in southeastern Massachusetts... Northwestern Plymouth County in southeastern Massachusetts... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 455 PM EDT, Radar and gage observations indicated thunderstorms having produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Torrential rains now across much of Rhode Island are expected to move northeast over the next several hours and heavy rains will resume over the warned area shortly. Rainfall rates may become excessive. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring, and worsened or new areas of flooding are anticipated. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. Law enforcement had reported flooding in Stoughton, Norwood and North Attleborough from earlier heavy rains. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low- lying areas. Sharp rises on smaller creeks and streams in the warned area are likely and may rise over bankfull. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boston, Cambridge, Brockton, Quincy, Lynn, Newton, Somerville, Framingham, Waltham, Malden, Brookline, Medford, Weymouth, Revere, Peabody, Arlington, Everett, Salem, Billerica and Beverly. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Bristol; Essex; Middlesex; Norfolk; Plymouth; Suffolk; Worcester
